div.p: SCLERIA, in botany: A genus of the tetrandria order, belonging to the monoecia claſs of plants; and in the natural method ranking under the 4th order, Gramina. The calyx has a gluma, with from two to ſix valves; the flowers numerous; the ſeed a ſort of nut, ſmall, oblong, and ſhining. There are ſix ſpecies, all of them natives of the Weſt Indies.
